Summary "Progress is impossible without change and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything". I totally embrace it and think that without change, there’d be no improvements. 
 
If I should describe myself in few words these would be my top six characteristics that will define me best: open minded, confident, ambitious, result oriented, friendly and communicative. 
 
Over the time, as an IT Support Technician I learned to have more patience, to maintain my cool and resolve the customers' issues emphatically, to be always focused on customers satisfaction, to handle surprises as you never know what will be on the other line. 
 
Before being promoted as an IT support technician, I started as a content specialist for Kno (Acquired by Intel) and I must say that I had not any idea what this job requires or offers me, but now I can proudly tell that I learned everything related to this job fast and I have knowledge of the following tools and processes: Adobe Acrobat, ePub conversion tools, Magma tool, XML generation, XML QA, JSON generation and QA, Glossary processing.  
 
Some of my objectives would be: To avoid repetitive and one-sided work, as I am always open to learn more and to do much more challenging things. 
To work with people, surrounded by people with different personalities and characteristics as everyone has something new to offer to each other. Summary QUALIFICATIONS 
Over seventeen years combined working experience as a Enterprise Data Center Manager, Fortune 500 Help Desk Division, IT Support Specialist, Systems Integration Engineer, System Platform, Chipset, Desktop, Mobile and SSD Validation Technician. I work well in multicultural, multifaceted IT environments: Concentrating on Hardware/Software issue resolution, Customer service, Process improvement, Problem resolution, System and Application Administration, Project management, Infrastructure monitoring, Safety, Training and disaster recovery. 
 
Performance abilities include exemplary Management, Supervisor, Individual Contributor, Training and Collaboration skill sets. Hands on: Hardware/Software troubleshooting skills owning a unique in-depth knowledge of Desktop, Laptop, Notepad, and Ultra Books configurations and limits, IT infrastructure sustainment, client relationship building and own a very strong set of communications skills. I own the ability to comprehensively troubleshoot, document and resolve all aspects of IT issues. This includes application, hardware, and infrastructure issues utilizing applications such as Remedy for thorough ticketing and trend monitoring while responsibly educating clients promoting IT sustainability, security standards and productivity. Experience In the market California Platform Validation Technician Intel Corporation / Kelly March 2011  –  December 2013  (2 years 10 months) Folsom California •	Desktop, Laptop, Tablet platform validation for Solid State Hard Drive (SSD) Firmware. Testing and validating compatibility to architecture while interfacing with all generations of Operating Systems and Chipset platforms while utilizing various combinations Intel, Apple, and OEM motherboard manufactures with multiple generations of BIOS configurations: 
o	Chipsets ICH7-10, PCH (all gens) and AMD 
o	Microsoft: Windows XP, Windows 7 32/bit, Window 8, and Windows Blue 6.1: 32/64 bit Operating systems.  
•	This position required a complex in-depth knowledge of various hardware configurations and troubleshooting skills for multiple Operating System configurations and compatibility (drivers, memory, bios, audio/video components/power supplies/fans/ Mother Boards) to determine and resolve various failure points on next generation Solid State Drives.  
•	Required use and knowledge using SQL tools, Python scripts, Batch Files, Excel, Proprietary Lenovo IX OS tools, Proprietary HP Environmental Tools, Thermal Chambers, Power Analyzers thermal chambers, LeCroy Analyzers, programmable voltmeter, current source, power suppliers, scope, and DAQ systems. Prepare test planning, execute the validation test, and provide accurate test results to ready product for market. IT Support Specialist - Independent Consultant Independent IT Consultant/Contractor January 2009  –  January 2011  (2 years 1 month) California/Arizona •	Data migration to new OS environments; Setting up work stations, basic network configurations, system storage and back up functionality, internal Wi-Fi set up and configuration.  
•	Desktop support encompassing any issue including set up and or troubleshooting OS, software, hardware and network situations.  
•	Design and implement remote access abilities, Active Directory configuration, incident/problem management and ticketing management. Acted as liaison between vendor(s) and companies in the planning, design, and cost analyses for small business IT infrastructures. ( Nelson Tech, EITS, Franklin Templeton Investments, and The Tonopah Tribune) Enterprise Data Center Manager Intel Corporation January 2006  –  November 2008  (2 years 11 months) Folsom, California •	Provide and oversee primary support to Intel’s Enterprise Data Center environment.  
•	Monitor and manage data center integrity. Manage rack and row build outs, power, sustainment, cooling, capacity, forecast, and consolidation efforts.  
•	Develop delivery of services through effective monitoring, process improvement, problem prevention and resolution initiatives.  
•	Authored Intel’s Enterprise Data Center Disaster Recovery plan 
•	Project Management: Successfully managed an unprecedented ''live 1.5 megawatt'' upgrade to Intel’s Enterprise Data Center with zero impact to the client base, infrastructure or facilities.  
•	Working knowledge for SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley) and other government audit processes and procedures 
•	Manage operation and service level agreements between organizations with in the corporation, vendors and contractors.  
•	Work on strategic planning on future DC requirements.  
•	Oversee and implement new, power management (PDU, UPS, CRC, battery backup etc) with new trend energy conservation efforts plus maintain and manage Mainframe, tape libraries, WAN/LAN/SAN,AUDEX, Big Fix etc infrastructure integrity. Server Integration Engineer Intel Corporation January 2003  –  January 2006  (3 years 1 month) Folsom California •	Provide technical support to Intel’s Enterprise, Development and Lab Data Centers. Making quick and accurate judgment calls within broadly defined parameters for quick and absolute resolution to any Data Center, server, storage, security or mainframe technical issues.  
•	Plan, Coordinate, Schedule and Perform application maintenance. 
•	Analyze application and service performance to determine process inefficiencies and drive process improvement. 
•	Project management: Implement rack and row build outs, server landings and decommissioning 
•	ADASM management, (users, groups, permissions.
